alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 3:20PM MST until March 16 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. .Rain and snowmelt continue to cause elevated flows in Oak Creek. Areas along Oak Creek have the potential to increase quickly, reaching critical levels. For the Oak Creek...including Sedona, Cornville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM MST Thursday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 8.2 feet late this afternoon. It has now fallen below flood stage this afternoon, but remains above action stage. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Oak Creek Cornvill 8.0 7.5 Thu 3 pm MST 6.2 5.3 4.8 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM MST.
